title: Pressure Injury Prevention Simulation Training for Elderly Care Providers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic geriatric care theory and foundational skills in mathematical data analysis
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education using smartphone-based VR simulations. Contextual learning environment combining pressure ulcer prevention theory with real-case analysis

learning_goals: Learners can classify five risk factors for pressure ulcer development and rank them by frequency.
Learners can establish a 2-hour positional change plan in a simulation environment and represent it as a mathematical timetable.
Learners can perform practical tasks applying nutrition/hygiene data to pressure ulcer risk calculation formulas.
Learners demonstrate pressure ulcer management procedures step-by-step via VR scenarios while maintaining an error rate below 20%.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
